title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
description: You are given an array where the ith element is the price of a given stock on the ith day. You want to maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy one stock and choosing a different day in the future to sell that stock. Return the maximum profit you can achieve from this transaction. If you cannot achieve any profit, return 0.
input_format: An array of integers prices where 0 <= prices.length <= 10^5.
output_format: An integer representing the maximum profit.

examples.explanation: Buy on day 2 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 6). The profit is 6 - 1 = 5.
In this case, no transactions are done and the max profit is 0.

hints: Keep track of the minimum price encountered so far.
Calculate profit at each step and maintain the maximum profit.

title: Check If Array Pairs Are Divisible by k
description: Given an array of integers and an integer k, determine if it is possible to form pairs in the array such that the sum of each pair is divisible by k. Each element in the array can be used in exactly one pair. If it is possible to form such pairs, return true, otherwise return false.
input_format: An integer array nums and an integer k.
output_format: A boolean indicating whether the pairs can be formed as required.

examples.explanation: Pairs can be formed as (9, 3) and (7, 5); both pairs sum to 12 and 12 is divisible by 6.
It is not possible to form pairs such that the sum of each pair is divisible by 5.

hints: Consider the remainders when each number is divided by k.

title: Text Justification
description:
Given an array of words and a length maxWidth, format the text such that each line has exactly maxWidth characters and is fully justified. You should pack all words in a greedy approach: first try to use as many words as possible in each line. The last line should be left-justified. The formatting rules are as follows: 
- You should insert spaces such that each line has exactly maxWidth characters. 
- You should try to make the text as justified as possible by adding spaces between words. 
- Extra spaces should be distributed evenly between words, with the extra spaces, if any, added to the leftmost gaps. 
- If the line contains only one word, it should be left-justified and no extra spaces are added to the end.
input_format: An array of strings words and an integer maxWidth.
output_format: A list of strings representing the fully justified text.

examples.explanation: The first line is justified with spaces, and the last line is left-justified.
The lines are formatted according to the justification rules.

hints: Consider how to calculate the number of spaces needed between words.
Think about how to handle the last line separately.

title: Move Zeroes
description: Given an array of integers, you need to move all the zeroes in the array to the end while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements. Do this in place and without using additional space.
output_format: The modified array with all zeroes moved to the end.

examples.explanation: The non-zero elements are 1, 3, and 12. After moving the zeroes, they appear at the back.
After moving the zeroes, the array contains 1 at the front followed by two zeroes.

hints: Use two pointers to keep track of the position of non-zero elements.
